guide.title: User Guide
guide.subtitle: Get started with QingChen Mail
guide.step1.title: 1. Configure SMTP Channel
guide.step1.desc: First, you need to configure an SMTP channel. QingChen Mail supports two modes:
guide.step1.direct_desc: Direct delivery via local port 25. Suitable for servers with dedicated IP.
guide.step1.relay_desc: Use third-party services like Gmail, Outlook, AWS SES, etc. (Recommended).
guide.step2.title: 2. Add Sending Domain
guide.step2.desc: To improve deliverability, you need to configure SPF, DKIM, and DMARC records.
guide.step2.li1: Add your domain (e.g., example.com) in "Domain Management".
guide.step2.li2: Add TXT records at your DNS provider (Cloudflare, GoDaddy, etc.).
guide.step3.title: 3. Manage Contacts
guide.step4.title: 4. Create Email Template
guide.step4.li2: Variable substitution supported, e.g., {name}.
guide.step5.title: 5. Create Campaign
guide.step5.desc: Select audience and template to start your campaign. System handles queueing and sending automatically.
guide.faq.title: FAQ
guide.faq.a1:
1. Check if SPF/DKIM verification passed.
2. Avoid excessive exclamation marks or spammy words in subject.
3. Use a reputable SMTP relay service.
guide.faq.a2: Many cloud providers (e.g., AWS EC2, Google Cloud, Azure) block outbound port 25 by default. In this case, you must use an SMTP relay service (using port 465 or 587).
guide.faq.a3:
To receive emails:
1. Add an MX record in DNS pointing to your server IP.
2. Ensure port 25 is open.
3. If QingChen Mail listens on non-25 port (e.g., 2525), use iptables to forward port 25 traffic.
4. Add a forwarding rule in 'Domain Management'.
guide.faq.a4:
STARTTLS upgrades an insecure plaintext connection to a secure one (SSL/TLS).
Enabling it prevents eavesdropping and improves delivery reputation with providers like Gmail.
You need to configure valid SSL certificates in 'Settings' to enable this.
guide.advanced.title: Advanced: Port Forwarding
guide.advanced.desc: If you cannot bind to port 25 directly, use these methods to forward port 25 traffic to 2525 (QingChen Mail port).
